item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H2166-2167)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H2166-2167)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 130.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H2166-2167)
Mr. Manzullo moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

summary.text:
Expresses support for the goals and ideals of National Indoor Comfort Week, as proposed by the Air Conditioning Contractors of America (April 17-23, 2005).

Recognizes the contributions that environmental systems (heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration systems) have made to our quality of life and commends system technicians.

Recognizes that the small business contractors who install such systems have benefited from a reduced regulatory burden, commends such contractors for participating in Occupational Safety and Health Administration panels, and recognizes that such contractors have actively supported the Small Business Administration loan guarantee program.

Expresses support for the goals and ideals of National Indoor Comfort Week, as proposed by the Air Conditioning Contractors of America (April 17-23, 2005).

Recognizes the contributions that environmental systems (heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration systems) have made to our quality of life and commends system technicians.

Recognizes that the small business contractors who install such systems have benefited from a reduced regulatory burden, commends such contractors for participating in Occupational Safety and Health Administration panels, and recognizes that such contractors have actively supported the Small Business Administration loan guarantee program.

bill.title: Recognizing the contributions of environmental systems and the technicians who install and maintain them to the quality of life of all Americans and supporting the goals and ideals of National Indoor Comfort Week.

item.title: Recognizing the contributions of environmental systems and the technicians who install and maintain them to the quality of life of all Americans and supporting the goals and ideals of National Indoor Comfort Week.

Recognizing the contributions of environmental systems and the technicians who install and maintain them to the quality of life of all Americans and supporting the goals and ideals of National Indoor Comfort Week.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
